commit message:
Time to drop support for APIs <2.1. There are still some people using
Giggity on old phones but 0.9.9 should be fine for them - the Android Market
lets me publish APKs for specific API versions so Giggity will continue to
be installable for them.

Also bumping target version to 14 (ICS) which makes the app look a little
more current on >=Honeycomb devices. Also it seems that some newer devices
omit old API version apps from the Market or even refuse to install them;
maybe this will fix that.

Widget updates: Translations, better alignment on ICS, include speaker + room
info.
Honeycomb+ fix: Hide progress indicator when starting up.
Oops, forgot to rename this in VCS.

Reference counting on Db.Connection. I finally realised that this: 'Once
opened successfully, the database is cached, so you can call this method
every time you need to write to the database.' on
http://developer.android.com/reference/android/database/sqlite/SQLiteOpenHelper.html#getWritableDatabase%28%29
matters for me.. :-/

Hopefully this is finally robust. This code has been *disastrous*.

Only update the widget once every 24h. We're already updating it whenever
we're touching alarms/reminders anyway.

When using ScheduleListView for showing search results, it's multiday. So
don't show day switch buttons or other bad stuff.

Give a warning in EventDialog if an event overlaps with another (marked
as interesting) event.

In TimeTable, if all talks in a room are in the same track, show the track
name in the room header.

Don't hide the progress indicator dialog when the user taps somewhere on the
screen.
